transcript:
came to the fire, squatted on his heels, held his hands to the blaze, and turned away his face. 
"You don't mind, your honor?" he asked Tu- shin. "I've lost my company, your honor. I don't know where . . . such bad luck!" 
With the soldier, an infantry officer with a bandaged cheek came up to the bonfire, and addressing Tushin asked him to have the guns moved a trifle to let a wagon go past. After he had gone, two soldiers rushed to the campfire. They were quarreling and fighting desperat
